page.title: 17GOVERNMENT- TOWN COUNCIL
page.content: There are 7 men and 2 women sitting on the Council, mainly professional people.They stand for election every 3 years by the rate payers of Northleach . Meetings are monthly, the public attend but can only speak at the annual meeting which provides a useful exchange of views. Decisions are taken by a voting majority. Their power is limited but is not decreasing in the town. They do however steer away from controversial views. They are financed by rates and have been rate capped to 5%. Finance is the limiting factor for their plans. Their responsibilities include: street cleaning and lighting, main_ tenance of the cemetery, paying the clerk and giving permission for events to take place in the town centre. With the recent bypass, a major achievement ,the council see many opportunities.
